solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (24 \times 13 + 13 \times 8 + 24 \times 8) = 1216 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 2.6 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(1216 \times 2.6\)
= Rs. 3161.6

content.text: Latika needs to paint a rectangular box from the outside. The cost of painting the box is Rs. 2.6 per \(cm^2.\) If the dimensions of the box are \(24 cm \times 13 cm \times 8 cm\), what is the total cost of painting the box?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area

solution.text:
Volume of the brick wall \(= 10 m \times 2 m \times 0.5 m = 10 m^3\)
Volume of one brick \(= 20 cm \times 10 cm \times 5 cm = 1000 cm^3\)
\(1 m^3 = 1000000 cm^3\)
Therefore, number of bricks required \(= 10 \times \frac{1000000}{1000}\)
\(= 10000\)

content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 104 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(104 m^2\)
Therefore, \(104 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{104}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{1}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 1 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

hint.text: Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2 (lb + bh + lh)\)

solution.text:
Area of school floor \(= 10032 m^2\)
Area of each tile = \(Base \times height = 22 \times 12 = 264 cm^2\)
Since the tiles can be perfectly broken into smaller parts, the number of tiles required is the area of the floor divided by the area of each tile. Also, remember that \(1m^2 = 10000 cm^2\)
Therefore, Number of tiles = 380000

=\(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}\times 1936 cm^2\)
Therefore, volume of water added = Area of base \(\times\) Rise in water Level
=125598 \(cm^3\)

Volume of water added = 125.6 L

content.text: The water tank in Rekha’s house has a base in the shape of an equilateral triangle with each side measuring 44 cm. It is filled with water till a height of 3 metres. She pours some more water into the tank and the new level is 4.5 metres. What volume of water did she pour into the tank? Use \(\sqrt{3} = 1.73\)

solution.text:
Cross section of river area = Area of 1 + Area of 2 \(= ac \times \frac 12 (d-c) (a+b) = 138 \times 40 + \frac 12 \times 54\times(138 + 108)\)
\(= 12162 m^2\)
Rate of flow = 5 km/hr = 5000 m/hr
Volume of water flow = Area of cross section \(\times\) Rate of flow
\(= 12162 \times 5000 = 60810000 m^3/hr\)
= 60810 megalitre/hr
One week = 7 days =\( 24 \times 7\) hours = 168 hours
Therefore, volume of water flowing into the sea in one week \(= 168 \times 60810\)
= 10216080 megalitres

solution.text:

Volume of new cuboid = \(lbh\) = Volume of cylinder
Therefore, \(lbh = 20428.57 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow 25 \times 23 \times h = 20428.57 cm^3\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {20428.57}{25 \times 23} = 35.53\)
The new cuboid is 35.53 cm tall

content.text: The area of the base of a cylinder is \(38 cm^2\). Its height is 32 cm. What is the volume?

solution.text:
Curved surface area (CSA) = \(2\pi rh\)
Total surface area = \(2\pi r (r+h) = 2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 3 \times CSA = 7392\)
Therefore, \(2\pi r^2 + 2\pi rh = 6\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow 2\pi r^2 = 4\pi rh\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 2h\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2}\)
\(CSA = \frac{7392}3 = 2\pi rh = 2\pi r(\frac {r}{2}) = \pi r^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area of Base = \(\pi r^2 = \frac{7392}3\)
\(\Rightarrow r^2 = \frac {7392\times 7}{3\times 22}\)
\(\Rightarrow r = 28 cm\)
\(\Rightarrow h = \frac {r}{2} = 14 cm\)
Therefore, volume \(= \pi r^2h = 34496 cm^3\)

content.text: You have set up a rain-water harvesting system at your home. A cylindrical container with a radius of 12 dm collects rain-water from your roof. solution.text:
Given the volume of the pipe = V = 12360.86 \(cm^3\)
The volume of a cylindrical pipe = \(\pi{r_ o}^2h - \pi{r_ i}^2h\)
Let the thickness of the pipe be \(x\)
\(\Rightarrow V = \pi (13)^2 \times 57 - \pi (13-x)^2 \times 57\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac {V}{57\pi}=13^2 - (13-x)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow (13-x)^2 = 169 - \frac{V}{57\pi}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 13 - 10\)
\(\Rightarrow x = 3\)
Therefore, the thickness of the pipe is 3 cm

content.text: The volume of a metallic cylinder pipe is 12360.86 cubic centimetres. Its length is 57 cm and its external radius is 13 cm. Find its thickness

solution.text:
Total Curved Surface Area = \(2\pi rh = 176 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow 2rh = \frac{176}{\pi} = 56 cm^2\)
Once you cut the slice, there are three faces without icing: The curved outer surface and the two rectangular inner surfaces. (Remember that the top and bottom surfaces have icing)
Also, length of Base of Slice = Radius of Cylinder and Height of Slice = Height of Cylinder
Therefore, area of the slice that has no icing
= Curved area of slice + 2 \(\times\) Rectangular surface area of slice
\(= \frac{1}{10}\)(Total Curved Surface Area) + 2 \(\times\) (Base \(\times\) Height of slice)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 176 + 2rh\)
\(= \frac {1}{10}\times 176 + 56\)
= 73.6 \(cm^2\)

= 10230\( cm^3\)
\(Mass = Volume \times Density\)
\(\Rightarrow Mass = 10230 cm^3 \times \frac{8.6 g}{cm^3}\)
= 87978 g

content.text: Rajiv likes to make 3D shapes from paper. Yesterday, he started with a rectangular piece of paper of length 29 cm and breadth 10 cm. He then rolled the paper into a cylinder so that the cylinder is now 29 cm long. What is the volume of the air inside the cylinder so formed?

solution.text:
Volume of original tube = \((\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h)\)
\(= 5958.86 cm^3\)
Now, Volume of new tube = Volume of original tube
Let the length of the new tube be x
Therefore,\(V_ {new} = (\pi{r_ o}^2 \times h) - (\pi{r_ i}^2 \times h) = (\pi (\frac {14}{2})^2 \times x) - (\pi (\frac {14}{2} - 6)^2 \times x)\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \frac {V_ {original}}{\pi (\frac {14}2)^2-\pi (\frac {14}2 - m)^2}\)
= 39.5 cm

Surface Area of the pipe = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims

\(= 2\pi \times \frac{22}2 \times 15 + 2 \pi \times \frac{6}2 \times 15 + 2\pi({\frac{22}2}^2 - {\frac{6}2}^2)\)
= 2024\(cm^2\)
Therefore, cost of painting the pipe \(= 2024 \times 0.2\)
= Rs. 404.8
